channel.title: Simple command help!

item.title: Simple command help!
item.dc:creator: @kris_sheehy kris_sheehy
item.description:
@kris_sheehy wrote:

Then why title it "simple command help", and next to noclip you wrote ::noclip <- Obvious if it isn't obvious to you then why write that.

These commands are not complex. You misunderstood me… The “Obvious” was put there because I did not think I would have to explain to an experienced coder such as yourself what “noclip” defines.

Read full topic

item.title: Simple command help!

If these are so simple and obvious why can’t you do it.

Add this in your client for noclip.
[/quote]

I’m new and I needed help. I didn’t come here to be put down. Thanks for the code. [/quote]Then why title it “simple command help”, and next to noclip you wrote ::noclip <- Obvious if it isn’t obvious to you then why write that.

item.title: Simple command help!
item.dc:creator: @mr_extremez mr extremez
item.description:
@mr_extremez wrote:

If these are so simple and obvious why can’t you do it.

Add this in your client for noclip.

[code=java] if(inputString.equals("::noclip")) {
for(int k1 = 0; k1 < 4; k1++) {
for(int i2 = 1; i2 < 103; i2++) {
for(int k2 = 1; k2 < 103; k2++)
aClass11Array1230[k1].anIntArrayArray294[i2][k2] = 0;

							}
						}
					}
				}[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Simple command help!
item.dc:creator: @Wank Broham
item.description:
@Wank wrote:

Use input strings for the noclip command one defect of this though people can just decomplie your client and change the player rights required you can always obfuscate your client though. And your no clipping command is a bit off as well, should look something like this

if(inputString.equals("noclip")) { for(int k1 = 0; k1 < 4; k1++) { for(int i2 = 1; i2 < 103; i2++) { for(int k2 = 1; k2 < 103; k2++) aClass11Array1230[k1].anIntArrayArray294[i2][k2] = 0; } } }

The triggertele void should have the int heightLevel ints in there, it’s basically like heightLevel = +1; simple operators. + for addition - for subtraction.

Read full topic

item.title: Simple command help!
item.dc:creator: @kris_sheehy kris_sheehy
item.description:
@kris_sheehy wrote:

I’m looking to make the following commands.

::goup <- Brings Character +1 Height on the map
::godown <- Brings Character -1 Height on the map
::noclip <- Obvious

Also I’d like to make the commands for players with 3 rights only.

Very basic I know! But my source was a completely blank 474 with no commands. Help pl0x?

Things to note: I know it goes in the commands.java, What I don’t know is how to actually make the codes.

EDIT: This is what I got so far…

} if (playerCommand.equals("noclip")) { c.noclip(); }

Read full topic
